featured.text: When the deer hear a combination of a 3-second- long recording of a deer’s snort and 20 seconds of a barking dog, they panic and flee rapidly.
The barking of the hound, which drives deer to panic, strengthens the effect of the warning noise, according to the RTRI.
People who are more sensitive to anxiety can panic after viewing a thriller.

In a panic (B) With delight (C) Out of sorrow (D) Filled with embarrassment 39. (A) they had seen my car (B) there was a shop nearby (C) they had seen two small girls (D) there was a police station in the neighborhood 40.

definition.zh_def: 驚慌，恐慌，通常因為突發事件或危險而產生的強烈不安或焦慮。
definition.en_def: A sudden overwhelming fear or anxiety, often causing irrational behavior.
definition.example: When the fire alarm went off, everyone started to panic and rushed for the exits.
